page.title: 11The Castle, St Andrews
page.content: Founded about 1200, reconstructed in the 14th. century and extensively repaired in the 16th. century, St. Andrews Castle is set on the edge of a cliff at the east end of North Street.It is open to the public every week day. It has a number of interesting features which include { {The Bottle Dungeon, The Well}and a subterranean passage called {The Mine {and Counter Mine.}There is a bridge across the moat which was drained some years ago. From the castle grounds which are very well cared for the visitor has good views of St. Andrews Bay and the West Sands. The Castle Shop and Ticket Office has a good selection of post cards and slides for sale.
